title: Engine ECM Electrical Connector Disconnect/Reconnect and Pin Numbering

body.body: Engine ECM Electrical Connector Disconnect/Reconnect and Pin Numbering
Disconnection of the Engine ECM Connectors
Never pull directly on the wires when disconnecting an electrical connector.
If you pull on the wires, the connector or the wires can become damaged.
Notice - General - Never disconnect ECM with ignition ON
Never disconnect an ECM when the ignition switch is in the ON position.
Disconnecting an ECM with the ignition set to ON can cause multiple fault codes to be logged in the ECM memory.
Always disconnect the battery, negative (black) lead first, before you disconnect an ECM.
Turn the ignition to the OFF position and wait at least 1 minute for the engine ECM to complete its power down sequence.

Engine ECM disconnect connect - CM8; CR8; CS8; DP5; DR5; DS5; HF8; HG8; HJ8; HK8; HL8; LG1; LG2; LGX; LH2; LJ2; LL1; LL2; LM2; LN2; PB1; PJ1; PJZ; PM1; PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC
Disconnect the three electrical connectors from the ECM by pressing down on the locking device and gently pull back on the connector.
Reconnecting of the Engine ECM Connectors
Damage to the connector pins may result if an attempt to fit the connectors incorrectly is made.

Two different sized connectors are used in the engine ECM, which makes sure correct connection is always made. Two 33 pin connectors are coloured grey (left, connector C) and black (right, connector B), and a 39 pin connector (centre, connector A) is coloured black.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: LM2; LL2; LG2; DP5; HL8; HK8; HJ8; HG8; HF8; PYB; PXB; PSB; PRB; LJ2; LH2; LGX; PJZ; CS8; CR8; CM8; PYC; PXC; PSC; PRC; DS5; DR5; PY1; PX1; PS1; PR1; PM1; LL1; LG1; PJ1; PB1

body.body: Fit the three connectors into their sockets and continue pushing until the locking device clicks.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: LM2; LL2; LG2; DP5; HL8; HK8; HJ8; HG8; HF8; PYB; PXB; PSB; PRB; LJ2; LH2; LGX; PJZ; CS8; CR8; CM8; PYC; PXC; PSC; PRC; DS5; DR5; PY1; PX1; PS1; PR1; PM1; LL1; LG1; PJ1; PB1

body.body: Engine ECM Connectors pin numbering - CM8; CR8; CS8; DP5; DR5; DS5; HF8; HG8; HJ8; HK8; HL8; LG1; LG2; LGX; LJ2; LK2; LL1; LL2; LM2; LN2; PB1; PJ1; PJZ; PM1; PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC
The illustration below shows the pin numbering system used in the Pinpoint Tests - Engine ECM.
Connector A is black in colour and has 39 pins
Connector B is black in colour and has 33 pins
Connector C is grey in colour and has 33 pins
As viewed on the mating face with the ECM (as per the illustration), pins are numbered from right to left with number one in the top right corner.

Engine ECM Connector Pin Numbering
The illustration below shows the pin numbering system used in the Pinpoint Tests - Engine ECM.
Connector A is black in colour and has 39 pins
Connector B is black in colour and has 33 pins
Connector C is grey in colour and has 33 pins
As viewed on the mating face with the ECM (as per the illustration), pins are numbered from right to left with number one in the top right corner.
